title: Getting from research to practice in M4D

references.title: A deeply embedded sociotechnical strategy for designing ICT for development.
EpiCollect: Linking Smartphones to Web applications for Epidemiology, Ecology and Community Data Collection.
Research Project as Boundary Object: negotiating the conceptual design of a tool for International Development
SensMobile: A Platform for Developing Mobile Context-Aware Applications.
SnapAndGrab – Accessing and sharing contextual multi-media content using Bluetooth enabled cameraphones and large situated displays.
Sorting Things Out: Classification and its Consequences.
The Digital Provide: Information (Technology), Market Performance and Welfare in

abstract:
In this paper we argue that, if technical M4D research is going to contribute positively to development, the activities of specialized, highly paid ‘researchers’ must be combined with skilled contributions from many other\ud actors. In particular, there is a critical need to develop the capacity available in development organizations, community based organizations, and in local economies, to innovate and to adapt technologies to support their objectives. This suggests that the methods that we adopt in research and in design should be open to local appropriation and contribute to capacity building, and that\ud education programmes are needed in developing countries to support the broader processes of innovation.

\ud

We describe the Mobile Innovation & Enterprise partnership, which is working to develop the innovation capacity available in Uganda.

In particular, there is a critical need to develop the capacity available in development organizations, community based organizations, and in local economies, to innovate and to adapt technologies to support their objectives. This suggests that the methods that we adopt in research and in design should be open to local appropriation and contribute to capacity building, and that\ud education programmes are needed in developing countries to support the broader processes of innovation.

\ud
